22.content:
When a character's belly makes sloshing sounds, indicating a liquid substance moving around within it, usually specifically ingested liquid within the character's stomach, but can also be related to other parts inside the belly (cum inside the uterus, cum or liquid from an enema within the rectum etc.).

Sloshing bellies can be often seen in stuffing and inflation (particularly cum inflation) content, as well as in vore scenarios, particularly after vore. Belly sloshing noises may be represented by "slosh" as onomatopoeia, or with more evocative sound effects like "slsh" "glsh" "bloorp" and so on, these are often paired with emanating bubbles or motion lines to reinforce the liquid nature of the slosh, or the motion of the belly.

Not to be confused with Rumbling Stomach: this tag is specifically for sloshing created by liquid contents in the belly, not for hunger or digestive noises caused by the stomach or intestines. However, both noises may be present in the same image.

23.content:
Rumbling Stomach describes noises caused by muscular contractions in the stomach or intestines, most often indicating hunger or digestion. Alternatively these noises may also be used to indicate a character suffering from indigestion, nausea, or is imminently about to burp, fart or defecate. This tag should be used whether the noises are visual, or are audible sound effects in an animation. These abdominal sounds can be often seen in stuffing and inflation, and very frequently are a part of vore content.

A rumbling stomach is usually represented by onomatopoeia or sound effects such as "growl", "grrr", "gurgle", "glorp", "churn". These are often joined by iconography, including bubbles, squeans, emanata, or wiggling motion lines around the character's abdomen/belly. However, either text or icons may be used alone. Another way a rumbling stomach can be show visually is through a common cartoon trope that has the surface of the belly rippling as the stomach growls

24.content:
Belly jiggle describes slight, quick wobbling or rippling motions of a character's belly, often involving a character that is slightly chubby, overweight, or obese, or one with a bloated belly. Belly jiggling can happen in reaction to the character moving - jumping, walking, bouncing, and so on; indirect contact with a vibrating or shaking surface or object (e.g. a massage chair, or while riding in a car on a bumpy road), it can be frequently seen when a character is having sex, and it is also often seen when a character's belly is grabbed, shaken, lifted or dropped.

Belly jiggling in still images is usually more subtly drawn than jiggling of the butt or breasts, but is depicted in the same way, with "echoing" curved lines around the character's belly. In animated posts, belly jiggling is frequently shown along with the character's belly bouncing, and other parts of the body bouncing and/or jiggling. Belly jiggling should not be confused with bouncing belly, which describes a dramatic up and down shaking motion of the entire belly, rather than subtle wobbling or rippling.

27.content: A character being forced to eat or drink something. It can be prey, food, objects or anything else.

28.content: Object Vore or object swallowing, describes images where a character swallows non-food inanimate objects. The object may be swallowed to be regurgitated later, travel through the digestive system intact and out the anus, or in some cases, is digested in the stomach. Object vore includes images of macro characters swallowing vehicles, buildings, or planets. While these objects or structures may contain other characters, this tag is still applied. The object vore tag should always be paired with a tag describing the orifice that the object is ingested through.

29.content:
Object ingestion describes a character orally consuming an inanimate, non-food object.

Usually, this involves the character swallowing the object whole, less commonly, the character may bite off piece of the object, chew up the object, and swallow the chewed pieces or remains of the object.

This tag should not be confused with or applied to depictions of a character merely deep throating an object, where the object being held and inserted into the mouth/throat, simulating fellatio. This tag requires the object being actively eaten or swallowed, if not already inside of the character's body, as well as characters implicitly having ingested, and regurgitating the previously ingested object. This tag can also apply to technically edible items being consumed whole - such as a character swallowing a whole egg. 

Object ingestion may be shown in a humorous context, with a character gleefully eating absurdly inedible objects, or alternatively, accidentally swallowing an object. A character might intentionally eat objects to stuff themselves or to satisfy their hunger - either swallowing a large number of inanimate objects, or a single, very large object, causing their belly to bloat. Characters may also ingest objects to store them in their stomach, this is usually shown alongside the use of other orifices to store items.

An ingested object may end up being regurgitated, pass through the digestive tract and excreted intact, or end up digested in the stomach; however, few images explicitly show the fate of ingested items, and any result is usually only conveyed by dialogue, or implied by digestive noises.
